Snyk test report

November 2nd 2020, 9:38:39 pm

Scanned the following path:
  • trash:latest (deb)
393 known vulnerabilities
2660 vulnerable dependency paths
240 dependencies
Project docker-image|trash
Path trash:latest
Package Manager deb
Manifest Dockerfile

Incorrect Default Permissions

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: xdg-user-dirs
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and xdg-user-dirs@0.15-2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › xdg-user-dirs@0.15-2

Overview

It was found that system umask policy is not being honored when creating XDG user directories, since Xsession sources xdg-user-dirs.sh before setting umask policy. This only affects xdg-user-dirs before 0.15.5 as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Access Restriction Bypass

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: util-linux
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and util-linux@2.25.2-6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libuuid1@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libmount1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6

Overview

runuser in util-linux allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

References

  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Access Restriction Bypass

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: util-linux
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and util-linux@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6

Overview

The mkostemp function in login-utils in util-linux when used incorrectly allows remote attackers to cause file name collision and possibly other attacks.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

LibTIFF before 4.0.6 mishandles the reading of TIFF files, as demonstrated by a heap-based buffer over-read in the ReadTIFFImage function in coders/tiff.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.27.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Use After Free

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

** DISPUTED ** In LibTIFF 4.0.8, there is a heap-based use-after-free in the t2p_writeproc function in tiff2pdf.c. NOTE: there is a third-party report of inability to reproduce this issue.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2769
  • https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1074318

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

LibTIFF version 4.0.7 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in tif_lzw.c resulting in DoS or code execution via a crafted bmp image to tools/bmp2tiff.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

tools/tiffcrop.c in libtiff 4.0.6 has an out-of-bounds read in readContigTilesIntoBuffer(). Reported as MSVR 35092.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • Security Focus
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Integer Underflow

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

tools/tiffcp.c in LibTIFF 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (integer underflow and heap-based buffer under-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF image, related to "READ of size 78490" and libtiff/tif_unix.c:115:23.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory
  • https://blogs.gentoo.org/ago/2017/01/01/libtiff-multiple-heap-based-buffer-overflow/

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

In LibTIFF 4.0.7, the program processes BMP images without verifying that biWidth and biHeight in the bitmap-information header match the actual input, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read in bmp2tiff.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

** DISPUTED ** LibTIFF 4.0.8 has multiple memory leak vulnerabilities, which allow attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), as demonstrated by tif_open.c, tif_lzw.c, and tif_aux.c. NOTE: Third parties were unable to reproduce the issue.

References

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2005-2541

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tar
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › tar@1.27.1-2+deb8u2

Overview

Tar 1.15.1 does not properly warn the user when extracting setuid or setgid files, which may allow local users or remote attackers to gain privileges.

This is considered intended behaviour, as tar is an archiving tool and one needs to give -p as a command line flag

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • HP Security Bulletin

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tar
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › tar@1.27.1-2+deb8u2

Overview

pax_decode_header in sparse.c in GNU Tar before 1.32 had a NULL pointer dereference when parsing certain archives that have malformed extended headers.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Access Restriction Bypass

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › dbus@1.8.22-0+deb8u3 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13

Overview

systemd-tmpfiles in systemd through 237 mishandles symlinks present in non-terminal path components, which allows local users to obtain ownership of arbitrary files via vectors involving creation of a directory and a file under that directory, and later replacing that directory with a symlink. This occurs even if the fs.protected_symlinks sysctl is turned on.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Information Exposure

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › dbus@1.8.22-0+deb8u3 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13

Overview

systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub PR
  • MISC
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: shadow/passwd
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › shadow/passwd@1:4.2-3+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shadow/login@1:4.2-3+deb8u4

Overview

In shadow before 4.5, the newusers tool could be made to manipulate internal data structures in ways unintended by the authors. Malformed input may lead to crashes (with a buffer overflow or other memory corruption) or other unspecified behaviors. This crosses a privilege boundary in, for example, certain web-hosting environments in which a Control Panel allows an unprivileged user account to create subaccounts.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shadow/+bug/1266675

More about this vulnerability

Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: shadow/passwd
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › shadow/passwd@1:4.2-3+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shadow/login@1:4.2-3+deb8u4

Overview

shadow 4.8, in certain circumstances affecting at least Gentoo, Arch Linux, and Void Linux, allows local users to obtain root access because setuid programs are misconfigured. Specifically, this affects shadow 4.8 when compiled using --with-libpam but without explicitly passing --disable-account-tools-setuid, and without a PAM configuration suitable for use with setuid account management tools. This combination leads to account management tools (groupadd, groupdel, groupmod, useradd, userdel, usermod) that can easily be used by unprivileged local users to escalate privileges to root in multiple ways. This issue became much more relevant in approximately December 2019 when an unrelated bug was fixed (i.e., the chmod calls to suidusbins were fixed in the upstream Makefile which is now included in the release version 4.8).

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GENTOO
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub PR
  • GitHub PR
  • MISC
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: perl
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-optlist-perl@0.109-1 › libparams-util-perl/libparams-util-perl@1.07-2+b1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libsub-exporter-perl@0.986-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › liblog-message-simple-perl@0.10-2 › liblog-message-perl@0.8-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › libalgorithm-c3-perl@0.09-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libregexp-common-perl@2013031301-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › perl/perl-base@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

Overview

An issue was discovered in Perl 5.18 through 5.26. A crafted regular expression can cause a heap-based buffer overflow, with control over the bytes written.

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libregexp-common-perl@2013031301-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libcgi-fast-perl@1:2.04-1 › libcgi-pm-perl@4.09-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libcgi-fast-perl@1:2.04-1 › libfcgi-perl@0.77-1+deb8u1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-optlist-perl@0.109-1 › libparams-util-perl/libparams-util-perl@1.07-2+b1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libsub-exporter-perl@0.986-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › liblog-message-simple-perl@0.10-2 › liblog-message-perl@0.8-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libsoftware-license-perl@0.103010-3 › libtext-template-perl@1.46-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › libalgorithm-c3-perl@0.09-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libregexp-common-perl@2013031301-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › perl/perl-base@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

Overview

_is_safe in the File::Temp module for Perl does not properly handle symlinks.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • MISC
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Oss-Sec Mailing List

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: perl
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libsub-exporter-perl@0.986-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › liblog-message-simple-perl@0.10-2 › liblog-message-perl@0.8-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › libalgorithm-c3-perl@0.09-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libregexp-common-perl@2013031301-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › perl/perl-base@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. Perl before 5.30.3 on 32-bit platforms allows a heap-based buffer overflow because nested regular expression quantifiers have an integer overflow.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for perl.

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: perl
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-optlist-perl@0.109-1 › libparams-util-perl/libparams-util-perl@1.07-2+b1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libsub-exporter-perl@0.986-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › liblog-message-simple-perl@0.10-2 › liblog-message-perl@0.8-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libsoftware-license-perl@0.103010-3 › libtext-template-perl@1.46-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › libalgorithm-c3-perl@0.09-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libregexp-common-perl@2013031301-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › perl/perl-base@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. Perl before 5.30.3 has an integer overflow related to mishandling of a "PL_regkind[OP(n)] == NOTHING" situation. A crafted regular expression could lead to malformed bytecode with a possibility of instruction injection.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for perl.

References

  • CONFIRM

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • FEDORA
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • SUSE
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Buffer Overflow

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: perl
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-optlist-perl@0.109-1 › libparams-util-perl/libparams-util-perl@1.07-2+b1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libsub-exporter-perl@0.986-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › liblog-message-simple-perl@0.10-2 › liblog-message-perl@0.8-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libdata-section-perl@0.200006-1 › libmro-compat-perl@0.12-1 › libclass-c3-perl@0.26-1 › libalgorithm-c3-perl@0.09-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libregexp-common-perl@2013031301-1 › perl@5.20.2-3+deb8u12 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libmodule-build-perl@0.421000-2+deb8u1 › libcpan-meta-perl@2.142690-1 › perl/perl-modules@5.20.2-3+deb8u12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › perl/perl-base@5.20.2-3+deb8u12

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Buffer Overflow regcomp.c in Perl before 5.30.3 allows a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expression because of recursive S_study_chunk calls.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for perl.

References

  • FEDORA
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC

  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 4) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 268) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 and libpcre2 in PCRE2 10.23 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation violation for read access, and application crash) by triggering an invalid Unicode property lookup.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Uncontrolled Recursion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

PCRE 7.8 and 8.32 through 8.37, and PCRE2 10.10 mishandle group empty matches, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer overflow) via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by /^(?:(?(1)\.|([^\\W_])?)+)+$/.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • IBM Security Bulletin
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Oracle Security Bulletin
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for pcre3.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • ADVISORY
  • MISC
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

An integer overflow vulnerability was found in tiftoimage function in openjpeg 2.1.2, resulting in heap buffer overflow.

  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

There is a NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c:1943(jp2) of OpenJPEG 2.1.2. image->comps[compno].data is not assigned a value after initialization(NULL). Impact is Denial of Service.

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

convert.c in OpenJPEG before 2.1.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via vectors involving the variable s.

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

An infinite loop vulnerability in tiftoimage that results in heap buffer overflow in convert_32s_C1P1 was found in openjpeg 2.1.2.

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. Missing checks for header_info.height and header_info.width in the function pnmtoimage in bin/jpwl/convert.c can lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

An issue was discovered in mj2/opj_mj2_extract.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. The output prefix was not checked for length, which could overflow a buffer, when providing a prefix with 50 or more characters on the command line.

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the function t2_encode_packet in lib/openmj2/t2.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

There is a NULL pointer dereference in function imagetobmp of convertbmp.c:980 of OpenJPEG 2.1.2. image->comps[0].data is not assigned a value after initialization(NULL). Impact is Denial of Service.

Numeric Errors

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 1 in the bufferedReadPixels function in ImfInputFile.cpp could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Numeric Errors

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8

Overview

In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 8 in the storeSSE function in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

In OpenEXR 2.2.0, a crafted image causes a heap-based buffer over-read in the hufDecode function in IlmImf/ImfHuf.cpp during exrmaketiled execution; it may result in denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

makeMultiView.cpp in exrmultiview in OpenEXR 2.3.0 has an out-of-bounds write, leading to an assertion failure or possibly unspecified other impact.

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2018-10754

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: ncurses/libncurses5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bash@4.3-11+deb8u2 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bash@4.3-11+deb8u2 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-bin@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5 › readline6/libreadline6@6.3-8+b3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-base@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-bin@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Overview

In ncurses before 6.1.20180414, there is a NULL Pointer Dereference in the _nc_parse_entry function of tinfo/parse_entry.c. It could lead to a remote denial of service if the terminfo library code is used to process untrusted terminfo data in which a use-name is invalid syntax. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `[' in name or alias field" detection.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxrender/libxrender1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libxrender/libxrender1@1:0.9.8-1+b1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libxrender/libxrender1@1:0.9.8-1+b1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2 › libxrender/libxrender1@1:0.9.8-1+b1

Overview

The XRenderQueryFilters function in X.org libXrender before 0.9.10 allows remote X servers to trigger out-of-bounds write operations via vectors involving filter name lengths.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

  • https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2016-October/002720.html

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxrender/libxrender1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libxrender/libxrender1@1:0.9.8-1+b1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libxrender/libxrender1@1:0.9.8-1+b1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2 › libxrender/libxrender1@1:0.9.8-1+b1

Overview

Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) XvQueryAdaptors and (2) XvQueryEncodings functions in X.org libXrender before 0.9.10 allow remote X servers to trigger out-of-bounds write operations via vectors involving length fields.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

  • https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2016-October/002720.html

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

An integer overflow in xmlmemory.c in libxml2 before 2.9.5, as used in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.62 and other products, allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted XML file.

References

  • Chromium Issue
  • Debian Security Announcement
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • N/A
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

The htmlParseTryOrFinish function in HTMLparser.c in libxml2 2.9.4 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) or information disclosure.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MLIST
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=775200

More about this vulnerability

Use of Externally-Controlled Format String

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

Format string vulnerability in libxml2 before 2.9.4 allows attackers to have unspecified impact via format string specifiers in unknown vectors.

Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

parser.c in libxml2 before 2.9.5 does not prevent infinite recursion in parameter entities.

More about this vulnerability

XML External Entity (XXE) Injection

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

libxml2 2.9.4 and earlier, as used in XMLSec 1.2.23 and earlier and other products, does not offer a flag directly indicating that the current document may be read but other files may not be opened, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct XML External Entity (XXE) attacks via a crafted document.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue
  • MISC
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Improper Resource Shutdown or Release

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

xmlSchemaPreRun in xmlschemas.c in libxml2 2.9.10 allows an xmlSchemaValidateStream memory leak.

Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

xmlStringLenDecodeEntities in parser.c in libxml2 2.9.10 has an infinite loop in a certain end-of-file situation.

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libwmf/libwmf0.2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Overview

The _gdGetColors function in gd_gd.c in PHP 5.2.11 and 5.3.x before 5.3.1, and the GD Graphics Library 2.x, does not properly verify a certain colorsTotal structure member, which might allow remote attackers to conduct buffer overflow or buffer over-read attacks via a crafted GD file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-3293. NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third party information.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • HP Security Bulletin
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Oval Security
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • http://svn.php.net/viewvc?view=revision&revision=289557
  • http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2009:285
  • http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2010-0003.html
  • http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2929
  • http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2930

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libpng/libpng12-0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › libpng/libpng12-0@1.2.50-2+deb8u3

Overview

An issue has been found in third-party PNM decoding associated with libpng 1.6.35. It is a stack-based buffer overflow in the function get_token in pnm2png.c in pnm2png.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Additional Information
  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2

Overview

In generate_jsimd_ycc_rgb_convert_neon of jsimd_arm64_neon.S, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution in an unprivileged process with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10Android ID: A-120551338

References

  • ADVISORY
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • MLIST
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read libjpeg-turbo 2.0.4, and mozjpeg 4.0.0, has a heap-based buffer over-read in get_rgb_row() in rdppm.c via a malformed PPM input file.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for libjpeg-turbo.

References

  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MLIST
  • SUSE
  • SUSE
  • UBUNTU

More about this vulnerability

Excessive Iteration

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Excessive Iteration libjpeg 9c has a large loop because read_pixel in rdtarga.c mishandles EOF.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for libjpeg-turbo.

More about this vulnerability

Resource Exhaustion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10 › libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo@1:1.3.1-12+deb8u2

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Resource Exhaustion. In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c in djpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causing excessive memory consumption.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for libjpeg-turbo.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • ADVISORY
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MLIST

More about this vulnerability

Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libgcrypt20
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libgcrypt20@1.6.3-2+deb8u8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libgcrypt20@1.6.3-2+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › libgcrypt20@1.6.3-2+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › libgcrypt20@1.6.3-2+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13 › libgcrypt20@1.6.3-2+deb8u8

Overview

cipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libcroco/libcroco3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Overview

** DISPUTED ** The cr_tknzr_parse_rgb function in cr-tknzr.c in libcroco 0.6.11 and 0.6.12 has an "outside the range of representable values of type long" undefined behavior issue, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted CSS file. NOTE: third-party analysis reports "This is not a security issue in my view. The conversion surely is truncating the double into a long value, but there is no impact as the value is one of the RGB components."

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Uncontrolled Recursion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libcroco/libcroco3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Overview

libcroco through 0.6.13 has excessive recursion in cr_parser_parse_any_core in cr-parser.c, leading to stack consumption.

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: krb5/libk5crypto3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/krb5-locales@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Overview

plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub PR
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Double Free

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: krb5/libk5crypto3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/krb5-locales@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Overview

Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • GitHub Commit
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
