More about this vulnerability

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: krb5/libk5crypto3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/krb5-locales@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Overview

An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Additional Information
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0@0.13-4~deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0@0.13-4~deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0@0.13-4~deb8u2

Overview

jbig2_image_compose in jbig2_image.c in Artifex jbig2dec before 0.18 has a heap-based buffer overflow.

References

  • GitHub Commit

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2016-9397

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

The jpc_dequantize function in jpc_dec.c in JasPer 1.900.13 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via unspecified vectors.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://blogs.gentoo.org/ago/2016/11/16/jasper-multiple-assertion-failure

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

The jpc_tsfb_synthesize function in jpc_tsfb.c in JasPer before 1.900.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via vectors involving an empty sequence.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • MISC
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Reachable Assertion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

There is a reachable assertion abort in the function jpc_dec_process_sot() in jpc/jpc_dec.c in JasPer 2.0.12 that will lead to a remote denial of service attack by triggering an unexpected jpc_ppmstabtostreams return value, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-9154.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • N/A
  • Oracle Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2016-9389

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1

The jpc_irct and jpc_iict functions in jpc_mct.c in JasPer before 1.900.14 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure).

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

Integer overflow in the jpc_dec_process_siz function in libjasper/jpc/jpc_dec.c in JasPer before 1.900.13 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted file, which triggers an assertion failure.

CVE-2016-9391

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

The jpc_bitstream_getbits function in jpc_bs.c in JasPer before 2.0.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via a very large integer.

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8

Overview

JasPer 2.0.12 is vulnerable to a NULL pointer exception in the function jp2_encode which failed to check to see if the image contained at least one component resulting in a denial-of-service.

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

An issue was discovered in JasPer 2.0.14. There is a heap-based buffer over-read of size 8 in the function jp2_decode in libjasper/jp2/jp2_dec.c.

Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

There is an infinite loop in the jpc_dec_tileinit function in jpc/jpc_dec.c of Jasper 2.0.13. It will lead to a remote denial of service attack.

  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8

Overview

The jas_malloc function in libjasper/base/jas_malloc.c in JasPer before 1.900.11 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted file, which triggers a memory allocation failure.

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

An out-of-bounds heap read vulnerability was found in the jpc_pi_nextpcrl() function of jasper before 2.0.6 when processing crafted input.

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

There is a reachable abort in the function jpc_dec_process_sot in libjasper/jpc/jpc_dec.c of JasPer 2.0.14 that will lead to a remote denial of service attack by triggering an unexpected jas_alloc2 return value, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-13745.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • N/A

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2019-6470

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4

Overview

There had existed in one of the ISC BIND libraries a bug in a function that was used by dhcpd when operating in DHCPv6 mode. There was also a bug in dhcpd relating to the use of this function per its documentation, but the bug in the library function prevented this from causing any harm. All releases of dhcpd from ISC contain copies of this, and other, BIND libraries in combinations that have been tested prior to release and are known to not present issues like this. Some third-party packagers of ISC software have modified the dhcpd source, BIND source, or version matchup in ways that create the crash potential. Based on reports available to ISC, the crash probability is large and no analysis has been done on how, or even if, the probability can be manipulated by an attacker. Affects: Builds of dhcpd versions prior to version 4.4.1 when using BIND versions 9.11.2 or later, or BIND versions with specific bug fixes backported to them. ISC does not have access to comprehensive version lists for all repackagings of dhcpd that are vulnerable. In particular, builds from other vendors may also be affected. Operators are advised to consult their vendor documentation.

References

  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Memory Leak

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, some memory leaks exist in DecodeImage in coders/pcd.c.

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

An off-by-one read vulnerability was discovered in ImageMagick before version 7.0.7-28 in the formatIPTCfromBuffer function in coders/meta.c. A local attacker may use this flaw to read beyond the end of the buffer or to crash the program.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • MLIST
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • SUSE
  • Security Focus
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

In ImageMagick 7.0.6-6, a memory exhaustion vulnerability was found in the function ReadTIFFImage, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service.

In ImageMagick 7.0.6-6, a memory exhaustion vulnerability was found in the function format8BIM, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service.

Overview

In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25 and GraphicsMagick through 1.3.31, several memory leaks exist in WritePDFImage in coders/pdf.c.

In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, a memory leak exists in WritePSDChannel in coders/psd.c.

More about this vulnerability

Memory Leak

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, a memory leak exists in WriteDIBImage in coders/dib.c.

References

  • DEBIAN
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Security Focus
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

The ReadTIFFImage function in coders/tiff.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-26 Q16 does not properly restrict memory allocation, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • MLIST
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 has a memory leak vulnerability in ReadDCMImage in coders\dcm.c.

More about this vulnerability

Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

In ImageMagick 7.0.6-1, a memory exhaustion vulnerability was found in the function ReadMIFFImage in coders/miff.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • MLIST
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

ImageMagick version 7.0.7-2 contains a memory leak in ReadYUVImage in coders/yuv.c.

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.6-5 has memory leaks in the parse8BIMW and format8BIM functions in coders/meta.c, related to the WriteImage function in MagickCore/constitute.c.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Double Free

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

WriteEPTImage in coders/ept.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-25 Q16 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (MagickCore/memory.c double free and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • MLIST
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

Overview

In ImageMagick 7.0.7-24 Q16, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in IsWEBPImageLossless in coders/webp.c.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue

Overview

In ImageMagick 7.0.6-1, a memory leak vulnerability was found in the function ReadWMFImage in coders/wmf.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service in CloneDrawInfo in draw.c.

References

  • Debian Security Advisory
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Overview

In ImageMagick 7.0.7-16 Q16 x86_64 2017-12-21, there is a stack-based buffer over-read in WriteWEBPImage in coders/webp.c, related to a WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION check.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.6-5 has a memory leak vulnerability in ReadWEBPImage in coders/webp.c because memory is not freed in certain error cases, as demonstrated by VP8 errors.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability

Resource Exhaustion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

ReadWEBPImage in coders/webp.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-5 has an issue where memory allocation is excessive because it depends only on a length field in a header.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

In ImageMagick before 6.9.8-5 and 7.x before 7.0.5-6, there is a memory leak in the ReadMATImage function in coders/mat.c.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit

More about this vulnerability

high severity

  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 has a "use of uninitialized value" vulnerability in the SyncImageSettings function in MagickCore/image.c. This is related to AcquireImage in magick/image.c.

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer overflow in MagickCore/fourier.c in ComplexImage.

  • Debian Security Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer overflow at MagickCore/statistic.c in EvaluateImages because of mishandling columns.

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

In ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16, ComplexImages in MagickCore/fourier.c has a heap-based buffer over-read because of incorrect calls to GetCacheViewVirtualPixels.

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer overflow at MagickCore/statistic.c in EvaluateImages because of mishandling rows.

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: graphite2/libgraphite2-3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and graphite2/libgraphite2-3@1.3.10-1~deb8u1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › graphite2/libgraphite2-3@1.3.10-1~deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › pango1.0/libpangoft2-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › harfbuzz/libharfbuzz0b@0.9.35-2+deb8u1 › graphite2/libgraphite2-3@1.3.10-1~deb8u1

Overview

In libgraphite2 in graphite2 1.3.11, a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability was found in Segment.cpp during a dumbRendering operation, which may allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted .ttf file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Fedora Security Update
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub Issue
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gnupg
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg/gpgv@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › debian-archive-keyring@2017.5~deb8u1 › gnupg/gpgv@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5 › gnupg/gpgv@1.4.18-7+deb8u5

Overview

cipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gnupg
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg/gpgv@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › debian-archive-keyring@2017.5~deb8u1 › gnupg/gpgv@1.4.18-7+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5 › gnupg/gpgv@1.4.18-7+deb8u5

Overview

A flaw was found in the way certificate signatures could be forged using collisions found in the SHA-1 algorithm. An attacker could use this weakness to create forged certificate signatures. This issue affects GnuPG versions before 2.2.18.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Uncontrolled Recursion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\1\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, proceed_next_node in posix/regexec.c has a heap-based buffer over-read via an attempted case-insensitive regular-expression match.

References

  • CONFIRM

More about this vulnerability

Improper Data Handling

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Uncontrolled Recursion

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\1\1|t1|\\2537)+' in grep.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Untrusted Search Path

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

elf/dl-load.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.19 through 2.26 mishandles RPATH and RUNPATH containing $ORIGIN for a privileged (setuid or AT_SECURE) program, which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse library in the current working directory, related to the fillin_rpath and decompose_rpath functions. This is associated with misinterpretion of an empty RPATH/RUNPATH token as the "./" directory. NOTE: this configuration of RPATH/RUNPATH for a privileged program is apparently very uncommon; most likely, no such program is shipped with any common Linux distribution.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • REDHAT
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.27 contains a buffer overflow during unescaping of user names with the ~ operator.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

A buffer overflow in glibc 2.5 (released on September 29, 2006) and can be triggered through the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable. Please note that many versions of glibc are not vulnerable to this issue if patched for CVE-2017-1000366.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Exploit DB
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Oss-Sec Mailing List
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.27 contains an off-by-one error leading to a heap-based buffer overflow in the glob function in glob.c, related to the processing of home directories using the ~ operator followed by a long string.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

A memory leak in glibc 2.1.1 (released on May 24, 1999) can be reached and amplified through the LD_HWCAP_MASK environment variable. Please note that many versions of glibc are not vulnerable to this issue if patched for CVE-2017-1000366.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Exploit DB
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Oss-Sec Mailing List
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

An integer overflow in the implementation of the posix_memalign in memalign functions in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.26 and earlier could cause these functions to return a pointer to a heap area that is too small, potentially leading to heap corruption.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Oracle Security Advisory
  • REDHAT
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Improper Resource Shutdown or Release

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

stdlib/canonicalize.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.27 and earlier, when processing very long pathname arguments to the realpath function, could encounter an integer overflow on 32-bit architectures, leading to a stack-based buffer overflow and, potentially, arbitrary code execution.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • Oracle Security Advisory
  • REDHAT
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long argument to the (1) nan, (2) nanf, or (3) nanl function.

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() by realpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leading to a buffer underflow and potential code execution.

  • Exploit DB

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

An AVX-512-optimized implementation of the mempcpy function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.27 and earlier may write data beyond the target buffer, leading to a buffer overflow in __mempcpy_avx512_no_vzeroupper.

NULL Pointer Dereference

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

res_query in libresolv in glibc before 2.25 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and process crash).

Access Restriction Bypass

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Use After Free

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • UBUNTU

More about this vulnerability

Information Exposure

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gcc-4.9/libstdc++6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › apt/libapt-pkg4.12@1.0.9.8.6 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8 › ilmbase/libilmbase6@1.0.1-6.1 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › fftw3/libfftw3-double3@3.3.4-2 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › gcc-4.9/gcc-4.9-base@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › gcc-4.9/libgcc1@1:4.9.2-10+deb8u2

Overview

stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Information Exposure

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gcc-4.8/gcc-4.8-base
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gcc-4.8/gcc-4.8-base@4.8.4-1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gcc-4.8/gcc-4.8-base@4.8.4-1

Overview

stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Directory Traversal

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: dpkg
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › dpkg@1.17.27

Overview

dpkg-source in dpkg 1.3.0 through 1.18.23 is able to use a non-GNU patch program and does not offer a protection mechanism for blank-indented diff hunks, which allows remote attackers to conduct directory traversal attacks via a crafted Debian source package, as demonstrated by use of dpkg-source on NetBSD.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cups/libcups2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8

Overview

The browsing feature in the server in CUPS does not filter ANSI escape sequences from shared printer names, which might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted printer name.

References

  • OSS security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cairo/libcairo2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Overview

cairo-truetype-subset.c in cairo 1.15.6 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) because of mishandling of an unexpected malloc(0) call.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • SUSE
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Improper Check for Dropped Privileges

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: bash
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and bash@4.3-11+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bash@4.3-11+deb8u2

Overview

An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Origin Validation Error

high severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: avahi/libavahi-client3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › avahi/libavahi-common-data@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5 › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5 › avahi/libavahi-common-data@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5 › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5

Overview

avahi-daemon in Avahi through 0.6.32 and 0.7 inadvertently responds to IPv6 unicast queries with source addresses that are not on-link, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (traffic amplification) and may cause information leakage by obtaining potentially sensitive information from the responding device via port-5353 UDP packets. NOTE: this may overlap CVE-2015-2809.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • MISC
  • MLIST
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

More about this vulnerability

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: util-linux
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and util-linux@2.25.2-6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › e2fsprogs@1.42.12-2+deb8u2 › util-linux@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/libblkid1@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libblkid1@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › util-linux/libuuid1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libmount1@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libblkid1@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libuuid1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libuuid1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/libmount1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libmount1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libmount1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6

Overview

The parse_dos_extended function in partitions/dos.c in the libblkid library in util-linux allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted MSDOS partition table with an extended partition boot record at zero offset.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • IBM Security Bulletin
  • IBM Security Bulletin
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/utils/util-linux/util-linux.git/commit/?id=7164a1c3

More about this vulnerability

Race Condition

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: util-linux
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and util-linux@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6

Overview

A race condition was found in util-linux before 2.32.1 in the way su handled the management of child processes. A local authenticated attacker could use this flaw to kill other processes with root privileges under specific conditions.

  • Debian Security Advisory

  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug

  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: util-linux
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and util-linux@2.25.2-6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libmount1@2.25.2-6
