  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › util-linux/libsmartcols1@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › util-linux/mount@2.25.2-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6

Overview

Buffer overflow in text-utils/colcrt.c in colcrt in util-linux before 2.27 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted file, related to the page global variable.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub Commit
  • MLIST
  • OpenSuse Security Update
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug

More about this vulnerability

Divide By Zero

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

The _TIFFmalloc function in tif_unix.c in LibTIFF 4.0.3 does not reject a zero size, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero error and application crash) via a crafted TIFF image that is mishandled by the TIFFWriteScanline function in tif_write.c, as demonstrated by tiffdither.

References

  • Apple Security Advisory
  • Apple Security Advisory
  • Apple Security Announcement
  • Apple Security Announcement
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2483
  • http://www.conostix.com/pub/adv/CVE-2014-8130-LibTIFF-Division_By_Zero.txt

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

LibTIFF 4.0.9 has a NULL pointer dereference in the jpeg_fdct_16x16 function in jfdctint.c.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

LibTIFF allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and crash) via a crafted tiff file.

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

LibTIFF 4.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and crash) via a crafted TIFF image to the (1) checkInkNamesString function in tif_dir.c in the thumbnail tool, (2) compresscontig function in tiff2bw.c in the tiff2bw tool, (3) putcontig8bitCIELab function in tif_getimage.c in the tiff2rgba tool, LZWPreDecode function in tif_lzw.c in the (4) tiff2ps or (5) tiffdither tool, (6) NeXTDecode function in tif_next.c in the tiffmedian tool, or (7) TIFFWriteDirectoryTagLongLong8Array function in tif_dirwrite.c in the tiffset tool.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Advisory
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OpenSuse Security Update
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: tiff/libtiff5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › netpbm-free/netpbm@2:10.0-15.2 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcupsimage2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › cups-filters/libcupsfilters1@1.0.61-5+deb8u4 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10

Overview

The OJPEGPostDecode function in tif_ojpeg.c in LibTIFF 3.9.0 and 3.9.2, as used in tiff2ps, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) via a crafted TIFF image, related to "downsampled OJPEG input."

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • HP Security Bulletin
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Secunia Advisory
  • http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2209

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › dbus@1.8.22-0+deb8u3 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13

Overview

It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable.

References

  • Apache Security Advisory
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Access Restriction Bypass

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13

Overview

systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files.

References

  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › dbus@1.8.22-0+deb8u3 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for systemd.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • FEDORA
  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU)

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: shadow/passwd
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › shadow/passwd@1:4.2-3+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shadow/login@1:4.2-3+deb8u4

Overview

shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • RedHat CVE Database
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: shadow/passwd
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › shadow/passwd@1:4.2-3+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shadow/login@1:4.2-3+deb8u4

Overview

An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Access Restriction Bypass

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: shadow/passwd
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › shadow/passwd@1:4.2-3+deb8u4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shadow/login@1:4.2-3+deb8u4

Overview

initscripts in rPath Linux 1 sets insecure permissions for the /var/log/btmp file, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information regarding authentication attempts. NOTE: because sshd detects the insecure permissions and does not log certain events, this also prevents sshd from logging failed authentication attempts by remote attackers.

References

  • BUGTRAQ
  • BUGTRAQ
  • CONFIRM
  • Dead Link
  • Dead Link
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • VUPEN

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

The _pcre32_xclass function in pcre_xclass.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memory read) via a crafted file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

** DISPUTED ** In PCRE 8.41, after compiling, a pcretest load test PoC produces a crash overflow in the function match() in pcre_exec.c because of a self-recursive call. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this report, noting that there are options that can be used to limit the amount of stack that is used.

  • Debian Security Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: pcre3/libpcre3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › pcre3/libpcre3@2:8.35-3.3+deb8u4

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound libpcre in PCRE before 8.44 allows an integer overflow via a large number after a (?C substring.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for pcre3.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • ADVISORY
  • CONFIRM

More about this vulnerability

Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. It allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (attempted excessive memory allocation) in opj_calloc in openjp2/opj_malloc.c, when called from opj_tcd_init_tile in openjp2/tcd.c, as demonstrated by the 64-bit opj_decompress.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c:2226(jp2) in OpenJPEG 2.1.2. Impact is Denial of Service. Someone must open a crafted j2k file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

The sycc422_t_rgb function in common/color.c in OpenJPEG before 2.1.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted jpeg2000 file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub Issue
  • MISC
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

The bmp_read_info_header function in bin/jp2/convertbmp.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0 does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) in the opj_image_create function in lib/openjp2/image.c, related to the opj_aligned_alloc_n function in opj_malloc.c.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub Issue
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://blogs.gentoo.org/ago/2017/08/14/openjpeg-memory-allocation-failure-in-opj_aligned_alloc_n-opj_malloc-c/

More about this vulnerability

Divide By Zero

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions opj_pi_next_cprl, opj_pi_next_pcrl, and opj_pi_next_rpcl in pi.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted j2k files.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Commit
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow vulnerability in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function (openjp2/t1.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

NULL pointer dereference vulnerabilities in the imagetopnm function in convert.c, sycc444_to_rgb function in color.c, color_esycc_to_rgb function in color.c, and sycc422_to_rgb function in color.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted j2k files.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c(jp2):1289 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2. Impact is Denial of Service. Someone must open a crafted j2k file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

Heap Buffer Over-read in function imagetotga of convert.c(jp2):942 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2. Impact is Denial of Service. Someone must open a crafted j2k file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • GitHub Issue
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

Heap-based buffer overflow in the opj_j2k_update_image_data function in OpenJpeg 2016.1.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted JPEG 2000 image.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • MISC
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

OpenJPEG before r2944, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted PDF document, related to j2k.c, jp2.c, pi.c, t1.c, t2.c, and tcd.c.

References

  • Chrome Release
  • Chromium Issue
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • RedHat Security Advisory
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://pdfium.googlesource.com/pdfium/+/66d6538c0a97cff550cafdfeaebe8a3f0efbad89

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

Out-of-bounds accesses in the functions pi_next_lrcp, pi_next_rlcp, pi_next_rpcl, pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_rpcl, and pi_next_cprl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash).

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Commit
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Divide By Zero

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash).

  • GitHub Commit

More about this vulnerability

Use After Free

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › openjpeg2/libopenjp2-7@2.1.0-2+deb8u10

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use After Free jp2/opj_decompress.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.1 has a use-after-free that can be triggered if there is a mix of valid and invalid files in a directory operated on by the decompressor. Triggering a double-free may also be possible. This is related to calling opj_image_destroy twice.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for openjpeg2.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MLIST

More about this vulnerability

Numeric Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the uncompress function in ImfZip.cpp could cause the application to crash.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • GitHub PR
  • GitHub Release
  • MLIST
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • Ubuntu Security Advisory

Numeric Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the getBits function in ImfHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

OpenEXR 2.3.0 has a memory leak in ThreadPool in IlmBase/IlmThread/IlmThreadPool.cpp, as demonstrated by exrmultiview.

  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA

Numeric Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Numeric Errors

medium severity

Resource Exhaustion

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

** DISPUTED ** Header::readfrom in IlmImf/ImfHeader.cpp in OpenEXR 2.2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation) via a crafted file that is accessed with the ImfOpenInputFile function in IlmImf/ImfCRgbaFile.cpp. NOTE: The maintainer and multiple third parties believe that this vulnerability isn't valid.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read during RLE uncompression in rleUncompress in ImfRle.cpp.

Out-of-bounds Write

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds write in copyIntoFrameBuffer in ImfMisc.cpp.

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read during Huffman uncompression, as demonstrated by FastHufDecoder::refill in ImfFastHuf.cpp.

More about this vulnerability

Integer Overflow or Wraparound

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. Because of integer overflows in CompositeDeepScanLine::Data::handleDeepFrameBuffer and readSampleCountForLineBlock, an attacker can write to an out-of-bounds pointer.

Off-by-one Error

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an off-by-one error in use of the ImfXdr.h read function by DwaCompressor::Classifier::Classifier, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • CONFIRM

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read and write in DwaCompressor::uncompress in ImfDwaCompressor.cpp when handling the UNKNOWN compression case.

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an std::vector out-of-bounds read and write, as demonstrated by ImfTileOffsets.cpp.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • CONFIRM

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Write

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before v2.5.2. Invalid chunkCount attributes could cause a heap buffer overflow in getChunkOffsetTableSize() in IlmImf/ImfMisc.cpp.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for openexr.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • ADVISORY
  • DEBIAN
  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MLIST
  • SUSE
  • SUSE
  • UBUNTU

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to NULL Pointer Dereference. An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.5.2. An invalid tiled input file could cause invalid memory access in TiledInputFile::TiledInputFile() in IlmImf/ImfTiledInputFile.cpp, as demonstrated by a NULL pointer dereference.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for openexr.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • SUSE
  • SUSE

More about this vulnerability

Use After Free

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: openexr/libopenexr6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use After Free. An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.5.2. Invalid input could cause a use-after-free in DeepScanLineInputFile::DeepScanLineInputFile() in IlmImf/ImfDeepScanLineInputFile.cpp.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for openexr.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • ADVISORY
  • DEBIAN
  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • MLIST
  • SUSE
  • SUSE
  • UBUNTU

More about this vulnerability

Cryptographic Issues

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: nettle/libnettle4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › nettle/libnettle4@2.7.1-5+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › nettle/libhogweed2@2.7.1-5+deb8u2 › nettle/libnettle4@2.7.1-5+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › nettle/libhogweed2@2.7.1-5+deb8u2

Overview

A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: ncurses/libncurses5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bash@4.3-11+deb8u2 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bash@4.3-11+deb8u2 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-bin@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5 › readline6/libreadline6@6.3-8+b3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-base@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-bin@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Overview

In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: ncurses/libncurses5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gnupg@1.4.18-7+deb8u5 › readline6/libreadline6@6.3-8+b3 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › procps@2:3.3.9-9+deb8u1 › ncurses/libncursesw5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-base@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-bin@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Overview

There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: ncurses/libncurses5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/libncurses5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › util-linux@2.25.2-6 › ncurses/libtinfo5@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-base@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ncurses/ncurses-bin@5.9+20140913-1+deb8u3

Overview

There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libxml2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libxml2@2.9.1+dfsg1-5+deb8u8

Overview

** DISPUTED ** libxml2 2.9.4, when used in recover mode, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted XML document. NOTE: The maintainer states "I would disagree of a CVE with the Recover parsing option which should only be used for manual recovery at least for XML parser."

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=778519

More about this vulnerability

Numeric Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libwmf/libwmf0.2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Overview

Multiple integer overflows in libgd in PHP before 5.2.4 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large (1) srcW or (2) srcH value to the (a) gdImageCopyResized function, or a large (3) sy (height) or (4) sx (width) value to the (b) gdImageCreate or the (c) gdImageCreateTrueColor function.

References

  • Debian Security Advisory
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Oval Security
  • RedHat Security Advisory

  • http://support.avaya.com/elmodocs2/security/ASA-2007-449.htm
  • http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDKSA-2007:187

  • https://issues.rpath.com/browse/RPL-1702

More about this vulnerability

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libwmf/libwmf0.2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Overview

The (a) imagearc and (b) imagefilledarc functions in GD Graphics Library (libgd) before 2.0.35 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a large (1) start or (2) end angle degree value.

References

More about this vulnerability

Numeric Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libwmf/libwmf0.2-7
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2

Overview

Array index error in gd_gif_in.c in the GD Graphics Library (libgd) before 2.0.35 allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash and heap corruption) via large color index values in crafted image data, which results in a segmentation fault.

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libtasn1-6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › libtasn1-6@4.2-3+deb8u4

Overview

GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: librsvg/librsvg2-2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-common@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-common@2.40.5-1+deb8u2

Overview

The rsvg_pattern_fix_fallback function in rsvg-paint_server.c in librsvg2 2.40.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted svg file.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug

More about this vulnerability

Resource Exhaustion

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: librsvg/librsvg2-2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-common@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-common@2.40.5-1+deb8u2

Overview

In xml.rs in GNOME librsvg before 2.46.2, a crafted SVG file with nested patterns can cause denial of service when passed to the library for processing. The attacker constructs pattern elements so that the number of final rendered objects grows exponentially.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • FEDORA

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libpng/libpng12-0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › libpng/libpng12-0@1.2.50-2+deb8u3

Overview

An issue has been found in libpng 1.6.34. It is a SEGV in the function png_free_data in png.c, related to the recommended error handling for png_read_image.

Memory Leak

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libpng/libpng12-0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › libpng/libpng12-0@1.2.50-2+deb8u3

Overview

** DISPUTED ** png_create_info_struct in png.c in libpng 1.6.36 has a memory leak, as demonstrated by pngcp. NOTE: a third party has stated "I don't think it is libpng's job to free this buffer."

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Issue
  • Oracle Security Advisory

gif2png 2.5.13 has a memory leak in the writefile function.

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg62-turbo
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 and others

Overview

libjpeg-turbo 1.5.2 has a NULL Pointer Dereference in jdpostct.c and jquant1.c via a crafted JPEG file.

Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libcroco/libcroco3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Overview

The cr_parser_parse_selector_core function in cr-parser.c in libcroco 0.6.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and CPU consumption) via a crafted CSS file.

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libcroco/libcroco3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Overview

The cr_input_new_from_uri function in cr-input.c in libcroco 0.6.11 and 0.6.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) via a crafted CSS file.

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: libcroco/libcroco3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1

Overview

The cr_tknzr_parse_comment function in cr-tknzr.c in libcroco 0.6.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation error) via a crafted CSS file.

CVE-2004-0971

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: krb5/libk5crypto3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/krb5-locales@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Overview

The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • Oval Security
  • REDHAT
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • TRUSTIX
  • X-force Vulnerability Report

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: krb5/libk5crypto3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libk5crypto3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5support0@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5 › krb5/libkrb5-3@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › krb5/krb5-locales@1.12.1+dfsg-19+deb8u5

Overview

An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GitHub Additional Information
  • GitHub Additional Information
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jbigkit/libjbig0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › jbigkit/libjbig0@2.1-3.1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › tiff/libtiff5@4.0.3-12.3+deb8u10 › jbigkit/libjbig0@2.1-3.1

Overview

In LibTIFF 4.0.8, there is a memory malloc failure in tif_jbig.c. A crafted TIFF document can lead to an abort resulting in a remote denial of service attack.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0@0.13-4~deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0@0.13-4~deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › jbig2dec/libjbig2dec0@0.13-4~deb8u2

Overview

libjbig2dec.a in Artifex jbig2dec 0.13, as used in MuPDF and Ghostscript, has a NULL pointer dereference in the jbig2_huffman_get function in jbig2_huffman.c. For example, the jbig2dec utility will crash (segmentation fault) when parsing an invalid file.

References

  • Bugzilla Bug
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2016-9388

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

The ras_getcmap function in ras_dec.c in JasPer before 1.900.14 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via a crafted image file.

The jpc_pi_nextrpcl function in jpc_t2cod.c in JasPer before 1.900.17 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via a crafted file.

Out-of-bounds Read

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

The jpc_undo_roi function in libjasper/jpc/jpc_dec.c in JasPer 1.900.27 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memory read and crash) via a crafted image.

Reachable Assertion

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

JasPer 2.0.14 allows denial of service via a reachable assertion in the function jpc_abstorelstepsize in libjasper/jpc/jpc_enc.c.

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity

  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

Overview

JasPer before version 2.0.10 is vulnerable to a null pointer dereference was found in the decoded creation of JPEG 2000 image files. A specially crafted file could cause an application using JasPer to crash.

  • RHSA Security Advisory

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and jasper/libjasper1@1.900.1-debian1-2.4+deb8u6

An issue has been found in JasPer 2.0.14. There is a memory leak in jas_malloc.c when called from jpc_unk_getparms in jpc_cs.c.

Overview

JasPer 2.0.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted image, related to the jp2_decode function in libjasper/jp2/jp2_dec.c.

medium severity

Overview

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: jasper/libjasper1
