Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: imagemagick/imagemagick-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-common@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19

Overview

ImageMagick 7.0.8-35 has a memory leak in coders/dot.c, as demonstrated by AcquireMagickMemory in MagickCore/memory.c.

More about this vulnerability

Cryptographic Issues

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1

Overview

A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › gnutls28/libgnutls-deb0-28@3.3.30-0+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › iputils/iputils-ping@3:20121221-5+b2 › gnutls28/libgnutls-openssl27@3.3.30-0+deb8u1

Overview

The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack.

References

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519

More about this vulnerability

Improper Data Handling

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.

References

  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The DNS stub resolver in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before version 2.26, when EDNS support is enabled, will solicit large UDP responses from name servers, potentially simplifying off-path DNS spoofing attacks due to IP fragmentation.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Use After Free

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

Use-after-free vulnerability in the clntudp_call function in sunrpc/clnt_udp.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.26 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to error path.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Fedora Security Update
  • Security Focus
  • UBUNTU
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.27, when invoked with GLOB_TILDE, could skip freeing allocated memory when processing the ~ operator with a long user name, potentially leading to a denial of service (memory leak).

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

Stack consumption vulnerability in the regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a regular expression containing adjacent repetition operators, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD.

References

  • BUGTRAQ
  • Cert Vulnerability Note
  • Dead Link
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Exploit DB
  • MISC
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • SECTRACK
  • SREASON
  • SREASONRES
  • Seclists Full Disclosure
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • REDHAT
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Resource Management Errors

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c
  • http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89
  • http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2010-4051

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a regular expression containing adjacent bounded repetitions that bypass the intended RE_DUP_MAX limitation, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD, related to a "RE_DUP_MAX overflow."

References

  • BUGTRAQ
  • Cert Vulnerability Note
  • Dead Link
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Exploit DB
  • MISC
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • SECTRACK
  • SREASON
  • SREASONRES
  • Seclists Full Disclosure
  • Secunia Advisory
  • Security Focus

More about this vulnerability

Use of Insufficiently Random Values

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may guess the heap addresses of pthread_created thread. The component is: glibc. NOTE: the vendor's position is "ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability."

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

Information Exposure

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc.

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glibc/libc-bin
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glibc/libc-bin@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/libc6@2.19-18+deb8u10
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › glibc/multiarch-support@2.19-18+deb8u10

Overview

The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA
  • Fedora Security Update
  • GENTOO
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • Netapp Security Advisory
  • OpenSuse Security Announcement
  • UBUNTU

More about this vulnerability

Cryptographic Issues

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: glib2.0/libglib2.0-data
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and glib2.0/libglib2.0-data@2.42.1-1+deb8u3

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › glib2.0/libglib2.0-data@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-common@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › shared-mime-info@1.3-1 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › gdk-pixbuf/libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0@2.31.1-2+deb8u9 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpango-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › libcroco/libcroco3@0.6.8-3+b1 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › pango1.0/libpangoft2-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › liblqr/liblqr-1-0@0.4.2-2 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › pango1.0/libpangoft2-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › harfbuzz/libharfbuzz0b@0.9.35-2+deb8u1 › glib2.0/libglib2.0-0@2.42.1-1+deb8u3

Overview

** DISPUTED ** GLib 2.31.8 and earlier, when the g_str_hash function is used, computes hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table. NOTE: this issue may be disputed by the vendor; the existence of the g_str_hash function is not a vulnerability in the library, because callers of g_hash_table_new and g_hash_table_new_full can specify an arbitrary hash function that is appropriate for the application.

References

  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • http://mail.gnome.org/archives/gtk-devel-list/2003-May/msg00111.html

More about this vulnerability

Information Exposure

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gcc-4.9/libstdc++6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › apt/libapt-pkg4.12@1.0.9.8.6 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8 › ilmbase/libilmbase6@1.0.1-6.1 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › fftw3/libfftw3-double3@3.3.4-2 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › gcc-4.9/gcc-4.9-base@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › gcc-4.9/libgcc1@1:4.9.2-10+deb8u2

Overview

The std::random_device class in libstdc++ in the GNU Compiler Collection (aka GCC) before 4.9.4 does not properly handle short reads from blocking sources, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to predict the random values via unspecified vectors.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OpenSuse Security Update
  • OpenSuse Security Update
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gcc-4.9/libstdc++6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › djvulibre/libdjvulibre21@3.5.25.4-4+deb8u2 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › apt/libapt-pkg4.12@1.0.9.8.6 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › openexr/libopenexr6@1.6.1-8 › ilmbase/libilmbase6@1.0.1-6.1 › gcc-4.9/libstdc++6@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickwand-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › fftw3/libfftw3-double3@3.3.4-2 › gcc-4.9/libgomp1@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › gcc-4.9/gcc-4.9-base@4.9.2-10+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › gcc-4.9/libgcc1@1:4.9.2-10+deb8u2

Overview

Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=80180
  • https://gcc.gnu.org/ml/gcc-patches/2017-03/msg01349.html

More about this vulnerability

Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: gcc-4.8/gcc-4.8-base
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and gcc-4.8/gcc-4.8-base@4.8.4-1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › gcc-4.8/gcc-4.8-base@4.8.4-1

Overview

Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RHSA Security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=80180
  • https://gcc.gnu.org/ml/gcc-patches/2017-03/msg01349.html

More about this vulnerability

Access Restriction Bypass

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: expat/libexpat1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, dbus@1.8.22-0+deb8u3 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › dbus@1.8.22-0+deb8u3 › expat/libexpat1@2.1.0-6+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › expat/libexpat1@2.1.0-6+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › libwmf/libwmf0.2-7@0.2.8.4-10.3+deb8u2 › expat/libexpat1@2.1.0-6+deb8u6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › fontconfig/libfontconfig1@2.11.0-6.3+deb8u1 › expat/libexpat1@2.1.0-6+deb8u6

Overview

expat 2.1.0 and earlier does not properly handle entities expansion unless an application developer uses the XML_SetEntityDeclHandler function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption), send HTTP requests to intranet servers, or read arbitrary files via a crafted XML document, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) issue. NOTE: it could be argued that because expat already provides the ability to disable external entity expansion, the responsibility for resolving this issue lies with application developers; according to this argument, this entry should be REJECTed, and each affected application would need its own CVE.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Security Focus
  • http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213
  • http://www.osvdb.org/90634

More about this vulnerability

Improper Authentication

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5

Overview

The Debian initrd script for the cryptsetup package 2:1.7.3-2 and earlier allows physically proximate attackers to gain shell access via many log in attempts with an invalid password.

References

  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: coreutils
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, ifupdown@0.7.53.1 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › coreutils@8.23-4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › fontconfig/libfontconfig1@2.11.0-6.3+deb8u1 › fontconfig/fontconfig-config@2.11.0-6.3+deb8u1 › ucf@3.0030 › coreutils@8.23-4

Overview

chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • OSS security Advisory
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Race Condition

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: coreutils
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, ifupdown@0.7.53.1 and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ifupdown@0.7.53.1 › sysvinit/initscripts@2.88dsf-59 › coreutils@8.23-4
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/imagemagick-6.q16@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › fontconfig/libfontconfig1@2.11.0-6.3+deb8u1 › fontconfig/fontconfig-config@2.11.0-6.3+deb8u1 › ucf@3.0030 › coreutils@8.23-4

Overview

In GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX "-R -L" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition.

References

  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html

More about this vulnerability

Out-of-Bounds

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cairo/libcairo2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Overview

cairo through 1.15.14 has an out-of-bounds stack-memory write during processing of a crafted document by WebKitGTK+ because of the interaction between cairo-rectangular-scan-converter.c (the generate and render_rows functions) and cairo-image-compositor.c (the _cairo_image_spans_and_zero function).

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Reachable Assertion

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cairo/libcairo2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Overview

An issue was discovered in cairo 1.16.0. There is an assertion problem in the function _cairo_arc_in_direction in the file cairo-arc.c.

Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cairo/libcairo2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Overview

An issue was discovered in cairo 1.16.0. There is an infinite loop in the function _arc_error_normalized in the file cairo-arc.c, related to _arc_max_angle_for_tolerance_normalized.

NULL Pointer Dereference

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: cairo/libcairo2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra@8:6.8.9.9-5+deb8u19 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › librsvg/librsvg2-2@2.40.5-1+deb8u2 › pango1.0/libpangocairo-1.0-0@1.36.8-3 › cairo/libcairo2@1.14.0-2.1+deb8u2

Overview

Cairo version 1.15.4 is vulnerable to a NULL pointer dereference related to the FT_Load_Glyph and FT_Render_Glyph resulting in an application crash.

More about this vulnerability

Incorrect Authorization

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: bind9/libdns-export100
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Overview

To provide fine-grained controls over the ability to use Dynamic DNS (DDNS) to update records in a zone, BIND 9 provides a feature called update-policy. Various rules can be configured to limit the types of updates that can be performed by a client, depending on the key used when sending the update request. Unfortunately, some rule types were not initially documented, and when documentation for them was added to the Administrator Reference Manual (ARM) in change #3112, the language that was added to the ARM at that time incorrectly described the behavior of two rule types, krb5-subdomain and ms-subdomain. This incorrect documentation could mislead operators into believing that policies they had configured were more restrictive than they actually were. This affects BIND versions prior to BIND 9.11.5 and BIND 9.12.3.

References

  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • CVE Details
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • Gentoo Security Advisory
  • REDHAT
  • SUSE
  • SUSE
  • Security Focus
  • Security Tracker
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: bind9/libdns-export100
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Overview

ISC BIND through 9.9.9-P1, 9.10.x through 9.10.4-P1, and 9.11.x through 9.11.0b1 allows primary DNS servers to cause a denial of service (secondary DNS server crash) via a large AXFR response, and possibly allows IXFR servers to cause a denial of service (IXFR client crash) via a large IXFR response and allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (primary DNS server crash) via a large UPDATE message.

Reachable Assertion

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: bind9/libdns-export100
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Reachable Assertion. An attacker who is permitted to send zone data to a server via zone transfer can exploit this to intentionally trigger the assertion failure with a specially constructed zone, denying service to clients.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for bind9.

More about this vulnerability

Improper Resource Shutdown or Release

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: bind9/libdns-export100
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-client@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libdns-export100@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisc-export95@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › isc-dhcp/isc-dhcp-common@4.3.1-6+deb8u4 › bind9/libirs-export91@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19 › bind9/libisccfg-export90@1:9.9.5.dfsg-9+deb8u19

Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Resource Shutdown or Release. In ISC BIND9 versions BIND 9.11.14 -> 9.11.19, BIND 9.14.9 -> 9.14.12, BIND 9.16.0 -> 9.16.3, BIND Supported Preview Edition 9.11.14-S1 -> 9.11.19-S1: Unless a nameserver is providing authoritative service for one or more zones and at least one zone contains an empty non-terminal entry containing an asterisk ("*") character, this defect cannot be encountered. A would-be attacker who is allowed to change zone content could theoretically introduce such a record in order to exploit this condition to cause denial of service, though we consider the use of this vector unlikely because any such attack would require a significant privilege level and be easily traceable.

Remediation

There is no fixed version for bind9.

References

  • ADVISORY
  • CONFIRM
  • CONFIRM
  • DEBIAN
  • FEDORA
  • FEDORA
  • SUSE
  • SUSE
  • UBUNTU

More about this vulnerability

Improper Input Validation

medium severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: audit/libaudit-common
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest, meta-common-packages@meta and others

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › audit/libaudit-common@1:2.4-1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › meta-common-packages@meta › audit/libaudit1@1:2.4-1+b1

Overview

Audit before 2.4.4 in Linux does not sanitize escape characters in filenames.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • OSS security Advisory
  • RedHat Bugzilla Bug
  • Security Focus
  • Ubuntu CVE Tracker
  • https://people.redhat.com/sgrubb/audit/ChangeLog

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2019-9619

low severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13

CVE-2019-9619

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

low severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: systemd/libsystemd0
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › util-linux/bsdutils@1:2.25.2-6 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libsystemd0@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › systemd/libudev1@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd/udev@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13

Overview

An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur.

More about this vulnerability

Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

low severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: lvm2/dmsetup
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1 › lvm2/dmsetup@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › init-system-helpers/init@1.22 › systemd/systemd-sysv@215-17+deb8u13 › systemd@215-17+deb8u13 › cryptsetup/libcryptsetup4@2:1.6.6-5 › lvm2/libdevmapper1.02.1@2:1.02.90-2.2+deb8u1

Overview

** DISPUTED ** vg_lookup in daemons/lvmetad/lvmetad-core.c in LVM2 2.02 mismanages memory, leading to an lvmetad memory leak, as demonstrated by running pvs. NOTE: RedHat disputes CVE-2020-8991 as not being a vulnerability since there’s no apparent route to either privilege escalation or to denial of service through the bug.

References

  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC

More about this vulnerability

CVE-2018-4700

CVE-2018-1000845

low severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: avahi/libavahi-client3
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › avahi/libavahi-common-data@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5 › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5 › avahi/libavahi-common-data@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › ghostscript@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › ghostscript/libgs9@9.26a~dfsg-0+deb8u6 › cups/libcups2@1.7.5-11+deb8u8 › avahi/libavahi-client3@0.6.31-5 › avahi/libavahi-common3@0.6.31-5

Overview

Avahi version 0.7 contains a Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in avahi-daemon that can result in Traffic reflection and amplification for DDoS attacks.. This attack appear to be exploitable via unicast IP network packet with spoofed source address.

References

  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability

Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature

low severity
  • Package Manager: debian:8
  • Vulnerable module: apt/libapt-pkg4.12
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest and apt/libapt-pkg4.12@1.0.9.8.6

Detailed paths

  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt/libapt-pkg4.12@1.0.9.8.6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6 › apt/libapt-pkg4.12@1.0.9.8.6
  • Introduced through: docker-image|trash@latest › apt@1.0.9.8.6

Overview

It was found that apt-key in apt, all versions, do not correctly validate gpg keys with the master keyring, leading to a potential man-in-the-middle attack.

References

  • Debian Bug Report
  • Debian Security Tracker
  • MISC
  • MISC
  • RedHat CVE Database

More about this vulnerability
